title: Keen 6 Question
content:
I was wondering if anyone knows where there's an easy-to-install version of Keen 6? I have the game, but unfortunately it's on a 5 1/4" floppy disk. I'm just wanting to check here and see if there's another version of the game floating around the Internet before I go to the trouble of piecing together an old computer to copy the files.

Thanks!

title: Google is your friend
content:
Unfortunately, Keen 6 is still considered a commercial game, even though iD are too slack to sell copies of it. For that reason we're not meant to post links here. However, it's not too difficult to Google up a copy.

I'd go ahead and piece together that computer anyway, just to play the games on their native system (assuming your alibi is true[img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img] ). Nothing beats classic gaming on an oldschool system. Cave assectatorem Ductoris Alacris

A concerned member of the Preservation of Endangered Spleens Society

[url=http://jimsoft.spatang.com/]JimSoft Lair[/url]

title: Re: Google is your friend
content:
Yeah, agree with Spleen on the old-school system thing. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-smile.gif[/img]
And yeah, it's unfortunately not freeware.3D Realms: "Do you think there'll ever be a sequel to your game(s)?"
Tom Hall: "If I owned Keen, there sure would be. I don't consider that GBA game canon by any means."
